result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence James Hartman

records.addlTxt:
4:14 PM  Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann for Judge Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Lawrence James Hartman in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Lawrence James Hartman.  Prosecuting attorney Karl E Anderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file.  Atty Satorius makes statements asking for another PTC to allow time for DE.  DE confirms address.  Adjourned at 4:16 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

- AMENDED 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, William L.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

11:02 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lawrence James Hartman in court, in custody.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Lawrence James Hartman. Atty Satorius states he went over procedures for prelim hearing with DE, DE sates he would like to waive prelim.  Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty Satorius makes statements re bond modification.  Parties would like to continue to ARGN today. State to file information by end of week.  Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  State to provide discovery.  Adjourned at 11:10 AM.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

1:28 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood and intern Conner Smith in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lawrence James Hartman in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Lawrence James Hartman. DE does qualify for PD. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. DE updates mailing address.  DE is on PO hold. Waive speedy PH. Court quashes warrant. bph
